content.description: Source: “Chinese officials use hotlines to take the public’s pulse,” The Economist (4 February 2017)
content.question:
Respond to parts A, B, C, D and E.

Using the data in the graph, identify the total number of protests (to the nearest thousand) when Xi Jinping became leader.

Using the data in the graph, describe the change in protests resulting in detentions after Xi Jinping became leader.

Explain why an authoritarian government might try to prevent protests.

Based on the data in the graph, draw a conclusion as to why the Chinese government allows a certain number of protests to occur without detention.

Explain how the Chinese government has responded to a specific protest movement in China that has occurred between 2009 and 2016.
